result.execSummary:
The defendant William James Webster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to Work Release & Good Time.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation.

$1,169.77 Restitution, plus 10% surcharge of $116.98, for a total of $1,286.75.  Bond of $850.00 to be applied to Restitution and directly paid to the District Attorney's Office.  Probation to collect remaining balance of Restitution in the amount of $319.77, plus 10% surcharge of $31.98, for a total of $351.75.  If Defendant does not make a good faith effort to pay on Restitution, probation may be extended.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
$100.00 Domestic Abuse surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
May not possess or use firearms.

No contact with Terry Demulling unless restorative justice is completed.  
Not to possess or consume alcohol, but may be modified by Probation.
Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of Probation.
Must complete a Domestic Abuse assessment & comply with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant William James Webster in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 10:33 am  Ct 1 - Def plea of NC.  CT accepts plea, adj G & enters JOC.  Cts 2-3 - DRI.  Exhs 1-3 - O&R.

SENTENCE:  I/S - 4 mo PCJ, Subj WR & GT, 1 yr Prob, RHT - $1,169.77, plus 10% surchg of $116.98, for a total of $1,286.75, if not good faith effort, Prob may be extended, $265.60 fine, $200.00 DNA surchg, Dom Abuse surchg - $100.00 - all payable thru Probation.  No alcohol - may be modified by Prob, No contact w/Terry Demulling, unless restorative justice is completed.  No firearms.  Dom Abuse assessment & comply w/recomm.  Upon successfully completed Prob, may be expunged.  Bond to be applied to RST.  $850 to be sent to DA's Office for RST.  10% surchg to be reduced by $85.00.  Prob to collect the remaining.
